content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an example of how you can achieve this using Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```

In the function `keep_only_names`, we are filtering out those names in the list of words which start with a lower case letter. The `filter` function checks each element in the iterable and keeps it if the condition (in this case, whether the first character is uppercase) is true. Here, we use `x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1])` as the condition to check whether a word starts with an uppercase letter or not.

To use this function, you can pass your list of words as follows:

```julia
words = ["Dog", "dog", "Cat", "cat"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words)
```
This will print `["Dog", "Cat"]` since the function only keeps words that start with an uppercase letter.
